messages.message:
Hello team, we had a call with LG Technology Ventures and they used AIHub with Korean Documents.
They sent us some feedback on what is not working properly with Korean Documents:
```Excessive spaces between characters: When extracting Korean text, there were some unnecessary spaces inserted e.g. u n n e c e s s a r y ```
Is this something we can work on and improve?

Attached you can find some Korean Document samples.

cc: @shahz.shuja
@Raul Mächler Is it possible to share the document?
yeah, its these 2 i have attached
happy to help look at this too, i can speak korean @Raul Mächler
i don't see any docs attached though
would be great if you can give it a try to extract some of the fields and see if the spaces-issue is there
ah got it, thought they were supposed to be excel files. i'll give it a shot

I see similar results too. The highlighted parts in SS1 and SS2 are the excess whitespaces. This is like splitting up a word that's supposed to be written together (e.g. writ ten to ge ther). I tried cleaning up the table output but it hung for 3 minutes and failed..

I turned off table and checkboxes to use the advanced OCR model and it worked much better. Still some excess whitespaces (SS5) that don't exist in the original document but it at least doesn't separate a single word. (for example, in Korean it should be written as "publictransportation" but it splits it out into "public transportation" - grammatically incorrect, but not a huge deal imo).

If we could digitize using advanced OCR it would be best, but then table extraction wouldn't be possible... @Raul Mächler

great insight, thanks david.
I think with this feedback, I am able to create a change request
